definition: to walk over (to)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: The tiger paced up and down the cage.
Watching those blocky minifigures walk around their sets will make you smile.
sentences.chinese: 看那些块状迷你人偶在布景中走来走去会让你发笑。

sentences.english: She paraded up and down in her new hat.
sentences.chinese: 她戴著新帽子在人前走来走去。

sentences.english: He walked back and forth at the seashore, anxiously waiting for the return of the fishing-boats.
sentences.chinese: 他在海滩上走来走去，焦急地等待着渔船归来。

sentences.english: Panda always walks around and climbs up and down.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫每天走来走去，爬上爬下。

sentences.english: She walked around in the lightless room.
sentences.chinese: 她在黑暗的房间中走来走去。

sentences.english: Then he started up and walked about the Luxembourg garden like a madman.
sentences.chinese: 随后，他象个疯子似的在公园里走来走去。

sentences.english: She walks across a levee, blowing a whistle and waving her arms.
sentences.chinese: 她在大堤上走来走去，吹口哨，挥舞着胳膊赶鸟。

sentences.english: He was walking up and down the station platform.
sentences.chinese: 他在火车站的月台上走来走去。

sentences.english: I could hear the thug thudding about upstairs in his heavy boots.
sentences.chinese: 我听见凶手穿着沉重的靴子在楼上咯咯地走来走去。

sentences.english: He strutted up and down before the manager.
sentences.chinese: 他在经理面前大摇大摆地走来走去。

sentences.english: The baby put on his father's clothes and walked the way his father did.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝穿上爸爸的衣服，人模狗样地走来走去。

sentences.english: Cigarette in the mouth, he paced about most of the night.
sentences.chinese: 夜里大部分时间他叼着烟，在屋里走来走去。

sentences.english: The show has also had its contestants walk in a public square wearing bikinis.
sentences.chinese: 该节目还曾让选手们身穿比基尼在广场走来走去。

sentences.english: He tramped up and down in the office.
sentences.chinese: 他在办公室里沉重地走来走去。

sentences.english: I can hear him thudd about upstairs in his heavy boots.
sentences.chinese: 我听见他穿著沉重的靴子在楼上咯咯地走来走去。

definition: quick step
directly
to turn one's head/to turn around
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
at a fast pace
without leave/without consulting anyone
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
(literary) to move forward
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
large strides
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to pout/to stick out one's lips
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to walk slowly/to amble along/gradually/slowly
to wave (one's hand)
